squidpony.squidgrid

Class LOS

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.LOS

  • public class LOS
extends java.lang.Object
    Line of Site (LOS) algorithms find if there is or is not a path between two given points. The line found between two points will end at either the target, the obstruction closest to the start, or the edge of the map.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com

    • Method Detail

      • isReachable

        public boolean isReachable(double[][] resistanceMap,
                           int startx,
                           int starty,
                           int targetx,
                           int targety)
        Returns true if a line can be drawn from the start point to the target point without intervening obstructions. Does not take into account resistance less than opaque or distance cost. Uses the implementation's default RadiusStrategy.
        Parameters:
        resistanceMap -
        startx -
        starty -
        targetx -
        targety -
        Returns:

      • isReachable

        public boolean isReachable(double[][] resistanceMap,
                           int startx,
                           int starty,
                           int targetx,
                           int targety,
                           Radius radiusStrategy)
        Returns true if a line can be drawn from the start point to the target point without intervening obstructions.
        Parameters:
        resistanceMap - marks the level of resistance the the line per cell
        startx -
        starty -
        targetx -
        targety -
        radiusStrategy - the strategy to use in computing unit distance
        Returns:
